New Records: Zach Neto leads the Angels with a.254 batting average and has 31 doubles, a triple, 21 home runs, 36 walks, and 71 RBI this season.
Yordan Alvarez leads the Astros with 31 doubles, two triples, and 33 home runs this season.
Pre-Game Insights: The Angels have a 60-87 overall record and a 30-43 home record.
The Astros have a 79-68 overall record and a 37-36 road record.
The Astros have the seventh-best on-base percentage in MLB with.322.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The teams meet for the eighth time this season, with the Astros leading 4-3 in the series.
The game is the first of a three-game series.
Others: The Angels have a 37-21 record when they have more hits than their opponents.
Several players from both teams are on the injury list, including Mike Trout for the Angels and Kendall Graveman for the Astros.
